parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To choose, prefer. Probably akin to airo; to take for oneself, i.e. To prefer.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: To suffer ill-treatment with. From sun and kakoucheo; to maltreat in company with, i.e. endure persecution together.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Apparently a primary word; a people.
More, rather. Neuter of the comparative of the same as malista; more) or rather.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
For a season, temporary. From pros and kairos; for the occasion only, i.e. Temporary.
The faculty or experience of enjoyment. From a comparative of apo and lauo; full enjoyment.
